Name: Hate Crimes, Police Report to FBI
Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the New York city police department to collect data and report to the Federal Bureau of Investigation and others on hate crimes.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

      Section 1. Chapter 18 of the New York city charter is amended by adding a new  section 439 to read as follows:
      �439. Mandatory data collection and reporting on hate crimes.  The commissioner shall collect information on all crimes that manifest evidence of prejudice based on the actual or perceived race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, gender, religion, age, disability, or sexual orientation of the victim, committed within the city of New York, including the type of bias serving as the sole or contributing motivating factor; the nature of the offense; and the characteristics of the victims and offenders.  Such information shall be provided quarterly, utilizing the incident-based reporting system established by the New York state division of criminal justice services, to the United States department of justice federal bureau of investigation and the New York state division of criminal justice services.  A summary of such information shall be provided to the mayor and the speaker of the city council on an annual basis.
      � 2. This local law shall take effect immediately.
